jobTitle: Systems Firmware and Kernel-mode Engineer (Computer Vision)
jobDescription: We are hiring a software engineer to develop Firmware and Linux Kernel modules for a new Programmable Computer Vision Acceleration engine in the Tegra SoC platform. Our team delivers new features and improvements to realize the groundbreaking potential of NVIDIA mobile systems, ranging from self-driving cars, AV/VR, intelligent video editing and autonomous mobile robotics.  You will need to have a deep understanding of SoC principles, general systems architectures, memory management, CPU, threading, real-time scheduling, synchronization, computer networks and be comfortable around hardware specs.  Required expertise include operating systems principles, device drivers, memory management and scheduling, multithreading, strong programming in C/C++, computer networks, data structures, real-time systems and problem solving capabilities. What you'll be doing: As a member of the team, you will use your design abilities, coding expertise, and creativity to deliver state of the art real-time firmware and kernel mode drivers for a low power, high performance computer vision accelerator engine. You will craft elegant and tightly optimized solutions to exciting problems, take part in shaping the future direction of a new computational paradigm inside NVIDIA's mobile platform and engage in reciprocal work with your peers across NVIDIA.
